title: Charlie & the Chocolate Factory
description: A journey through Willy Wonka's Inventing Room, where users can design and print their very own edible creations.
author: Roald Dahl
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xaal3PCBO8w

content.caption: The user enters through the interactive corridor, which is an ever-changing and constantly evolving space. The floors and walls project captivating visual effects which respond to the users movements.

These visual effects produced by projection alter as more users enter the space. The corridor draws on elements from the story, such as the chocolate river, as a metaphorical transportation device, leading to innovation.
The user is transported by the 'chocolate river', into the inventing room. This is the space where the user will invent their own sweet, logo and packaging.
Once the user steps into the ring of their choice, the design process is initiated.
Using the interactive walls, the user begins their design.
Once the user completes their design process, their authenticity card prints from a slit in the wall. They then make their way to the production room.
The production room is a corridor of 3D printers with 2 sections, the packaging and the sweet production. Here the user can watch their invention come to life.
By scanning their custom barcode located on their authenticity card, the user can begin the production of their edible sweet and packaging.

The user leaves the experience with their own edible sweet invention, logo and packaging. These take-aways are a reminder of the individuals' creativity and are a means of encouraging innovation beyond the walls of the museum.
The immersive design aims to not only bring the narrative to life but also create a memorable and fulfilling experience for the user, by compelling them to use their imagination.
